name: The Westin Palo Alto

reviews.title: Did not honor reservation - consider confirming your online reservation
reviews.text: I had a room booked via Expedia for a stay here August 2008. My reservation specified a King. When I called the night before to confirm the reservation and make a request, I was told by the manager Paul that no kings were available. The call was then transferred to another manager Kaffe (sp?) who offered to honor the reservation by upgrading me to a larger room for $100. I obviously declined and chose another hotel in town. You might want to confirm any reservations made online to avoid a similar fate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was quite large as was the bathroom. The bed was clean and crisp and comfortable. The bathroom spotless. The rugs and upholstered furniture in the rooms could use some steam cleaning, but overall the hotel is clean and inviting. Location is excellent. Downtown Palo Alto is right around the corner and has excellent restaurants from pizza to fine dining. The front desk staff is friendly and very accommodating. Stanford University is right across the street and worth an evening stroll across the campus. It's a great location and only a 20 minute drive from downtown San Francisco.
reviews.title: LOVELY HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at the Westin Palo Alto for two nights while attending a Palo Alto High School reunion. I'm a fan of Westin Hotels (and Starwood properties in general), and this particular property is unique because of its smaller, boutique-style design (in contrast to the usual large, business style Westins in downtown areas). The hotel frontage is actually rather unremarkable. Because the hotel is placed very close to the road, it's easy to drive right by on El Camino Blvd without realizing it. The Westin and it's neighbor right across a parking lot, the Sheraton Palo Alto, seem to be jointly owned and managed.
reviews.title: Not Your Typical Westin
Nice Hotel, great location for Stanford and Shoreline Amphitheater

likes.disliked: — function being held right outside our room

reviews.title: Don't stay here if you like to exercise
reviews.text: 1) Spacious and quiet rooms with especially large bathrooms. Decor is a little more "traditional" than the usual Westin. Not too much of a view from any room. The small "courtyards" aren't worth more than a casual glance.

The Westin Palo Alto is certainly every bit a Westin...heavenly bed, rosemary and mint, Starbucks, lots of marble, etc...however, this one sees its share of international guests and I found out they don't all get the part about the smoking ban...nor did the front desk staff think it was much of an issue when a level of cigarette smoke I hadn't experienced since, oh, Moscow came through the adjoining door...but so what, since one can always stick wet towels under the door. The staff did their best to compensate in the AM with a free breakfast. The location near Stanford is fine, staff is fine...not a standout but it's a Westin.
reviews.title: It's a Westin, and it's in Palo Alto

reviews.text: A dependably good hotel, close to Stanford University, downtown Palo Alto, and the Stanford shopping center (Bloomingdales, Nordstrom, Neiman Marcus . . .) If you like walking, all of them are reasonably close.
reviews.title: Dependable hotel in a good location

reviews.text: My room overlooked a quiet courtyard, but one side of the hotel looks out over a very ugly derelict building. Try not to get those rooms.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: The bed, of course, is great. Bathrooms are fairly large. There's a separate tub, but it's shallow, and unless you're a child it's not great for a relaxing soak. The hotel brochure makes a big deal about the dual showerhead, but I couldn't get it to work. Speaking of things that didn't work, there's an "express service" button on the phone, which I pressed to request a pair of slippers. But it was disconnected.
reviews.title: Overrated for the money

likes.liked: — bed was very comfortable, location very good
likes.disliked: — lack of service and bad shower pressure

reviews.text: The hotel has three computer terminals for checking e-mail, but two of them weren't connecting to the Internet for some reason. How ironic that in Silicon Valley I had trouble checking e-mail!
reviews.title: Excellent time in Palo Alto
Charming hotel
reviews.text: I reserved this hotel using a combination of cash and points on the starwood website, which is a very good deal. I had a small, but perfect room with an extremely comfortable bed (one of the main reasons to be loyal to Westin and great natural light. The hotel is a short walk away (if you like to walk: 10-20 minutes) from downtown palo alto and its many restaurants, bookstores etc...The hotel restaurant was outstanding if expensive. The lobby was diminutive and lovely. Internet connection was touch and go but I didn't get charged for it because of that.

Actually cooked the eggs over easy I wanted with my breakfast buffet. (I detest the runny scrambled eggs that most U.S. hotels serve.) Room was nice, and location was convenient to Stanford, Cal Train, and downtown Palo Alto. Staff was very helpful.
reviews.title: Better than average breakfast buffet

reviews.text: The Westin in Palo Alto lives up to its reputation as one of the best business hotels in the bay area. The rooms are spacious, well furnished and have a fantastically comfy bed. My bathroom had a bath and separate shower and was spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Hard to fault

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wireless or wired broadband is available is the rooms for a small cost ($10/day) and there is secure parking directly underneath the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, great service, wonderful rooms
great westin
reviews.text: this is a very nice, fancy westin near stanford. the workout room is the usual westin workout, which is nice, and the rooms are large, quiet and clean. the staff is very helpful and friendly. if you can get a good rate here, i highly recommend it.

I've had mixed results at Westins - some are great, some fall short. This is one of the great ones. At check-in, as we had two young kids with us, they gave us a corner ground-floor room that opened onto a courtyard. Being able to have the door open, listen to the fountains and have the kids run around outside was great. It was also nice to order room service (excellent food and not very overpriced, by the way) and eat it in the courtyard. The room was very nice - no signs of wear and tear at all.
reviews.title: Excellent, Excellent, Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is excellent. They were also quick to loan me a BlackBerry charger when I forgot mine. We used the front desk staff several times, both in person and via phone, and they were always quick, friendly and helpful. There were always apples for the taking at the front desk as well.
reviews.title: Better than expected!

likes.disliked: — Veiw from room...most of the rooms had good veiws but I think we just got a bad draw...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well located - a 5-minute walk to the CalTrain station and a 15-minute walk to the Stanford Shopping Center. We took a train into SF for a day and it couldn't have been easier.
reviews.title: Luxurious boutique feel

likes.liked: — Gracious staff, lovely room, quiet, beautiful lobby/lounge area
likes.disliked: — In beautiful, sunny California the pool area was a bit small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only minor complaints: the lights in the room are either super-bright or off. For a diaper change in the middle of the night, a dimmer in the bathroom would be nice. Turning on the bathroom light at 3am was like walking into the sun. Also, the bathtub water pressure isn't adjustable. If you want warm water, you need to have full flow - not ideal for giving a toddler a bath, or letting the water run just a little for bath play-time.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for Parent's Weekend

likes.liked: — quality accomodations in a great location
likes.disliked: — limited choice of snacks in a room that serves as a rental car office
